name: Credit Suisse X-Links Crude Oil Shares Covered Call ETN
description: The Credit Suisse X-Links Crude Oil Shares Covered Call ETN (USOI) is an exchange-traded note designed to provide investors with exposure to the performance of crude oil prices while generating income through a covered call strategy. Launched in 2018, USOI tracks the performance of the S&P GSCI Crude Oil Index, which reflects the prices of crude oil futures contracts. Additionally, the ETN employs a covered call writing strategy, which involves selling call options on crude oil futures to generate premium income. This strategy is intended to enhance the overall return of the investment, especially in sideways or moderately bullish market conditions. USOI offers investors a unique blend of commodity exposure and income generation, making it an interesting option for those looking to diversify their portfolios with commodities, particularly crude oil. The ETN is issued by Credit Suisse and is structured to provide investors with a transparent and easily accessible investment vehicle. Investors should be aware of the risks associated with commodity investments, including price volatility and potential losses. USOI is particularly appealing to investors who are bullish on crude oil prices while seeking additional income through option premiums. As energy markets continue to evolve and respond to global supply and demand dynamics, USOI provides a strategic approach to accessing the crude oil market.

faq.question: What is USOI?
faq.answer: USOI is the Credit Suisse X-Links Crude Oil Shares Covered Call ETN that provides exposure to crude oil prices while generating income through a covered call strategy.

faq.question: How does USOI generate income?
faq.answer: USOI generates income by employing a covered call writing strategy, which involves selling call options on crude oil futures.

faq.question: What is the underlying index for USOI?
faq.answer: USOI tracks the S&P GSCI Crude Oil Index, which reflects the prices of crude oil futures contracts.

faq.question: Who is the issuer of USOI?
faq.answer: USOI is issued by Credit Suisse.
